etymologies: late Middle English (in maniple (sense 2)): from Old French maniple, from Latin manipulus ‘handful, troop’, from manus ‘hand’ + the base of plere ‘fill’

definitions: a subdivision of a Roman legion, containing either 120 or 60 men.
shortDefinitions: subdivision of Roman legion, containing either 120 or 60 men

definitions: (in church use) a vestment formerly worn by a priest celebrating the Eucharist, consisting of a strip hanging from the left arm.
shortDefinitions: (in Christian church) vestment formerly worn by priest celebrating Eucharist
